{{About|the relatively smaller and more frequent named updates to the game|annual updates|Major update|other uses|Drop (disambiguation)}}
[[File:Warm leash.jpeg|thumb|Screenshot containing features from [[Spring to Life]], an example of a game drop.]]
A '''game drop'''<ref name="bats and pots">{{tweet|CornerHardMC|1833203939426373917|"Bats and Pots" and "Armored Paws" are both considered "game drops"|September 9, 2024}}</ref> (or simply '''drop''')<ref name="shy friends">{{Mcnet|armored-paws|Shy Friends and Armored Paws|April 23, 2024|Cristina Anderca}}</ref> is a type of [[named update]] containing a number of features related to a theme. Three to four game drops are released each year.

== Description ==
Game drops are loosely planned up to two years in advance at the earliest, give or take, depending on community feedback.<ref>{{ytl|2cxUNoWNy50|לייב עם מפתח של מיינקראפט! עם ‪@Ulraf‬ !|AdirTV|August 10, 2025|t=9827}} (2:43:47)</ref> While the game is currently using the game drop release formula, there are plans for more [[major update]]s in the future.<ref>{{ytl|2cxUNoWNy50|לייב עם מפתח של מיינקראפט! עם ‪@Ulraf‬ !|AdirTV|August 10, 2025|t=12010}} (3:20:10)</ref>{{dubious|Needs a reliable transcript and translation of both segments, plus the part where Ulraf specifies whether his statement is factual or an opinion.}}

The game drop system was first announced with the release of [[Armored Paws]]. [[Bats and Pots]] was then retroactively called a drop. [[Tricky Trials]] would also qualify to be considered a drop, but is not officially considered one. Like major updates, game drops can be smaller, like [[Bats and Pots]], or larger, like [[The Copper Age]].

== Game drops by season ==
Game drops can be classified into four types, based on which Northern Hemisphere season they are released in:

* '''[[Spring Drop]]'''
* '''Summer Drop''' — so far only [[Chase the Skies]]
* '''[[Fall Drop]]'''
* '''[[Winter Drop]]'''

Although it is no longer the primary classification for game drops, [[Mojang Studios]] has used this nomenclature on several occasions:
* [[The Garden Awakens]] has explicitly been referred to as the "Winter Drop" during its [[experiment]] phase {{in|JE}}.
* [[Spring to Life]] and [[The Copper Age]] were respectively referred to as "Spring drop" and "Fall drop" in the <code>manifest.json</code> file of their respective experimental packs {{in|BE}}.<ref>{{tweet|SmokeyStack_|1877043357664378934|This Drop is indeed a spring drop! #Minecraft|January 8, 2024}}</ref><ref>{{tweet|SmokeyStack_|1940097777452601778|Confired{{sic|nolink=1}}, Drop 3 is the Fall Drop. #Minecraft|July 1, 2024}}</ref>
* [[Chase the Skies]] was named "Summer drop" by a Mojang employee.<ref>{{tweet|JustJosIt|1904455682041983227|The Spring to Life game drop comes today, the summer drop updates comes in June!|March 25, 2025|archive=1}}</ref>
* Some files on [[Minecraft.net]] use season to refer to drops in their names; for example :
** [https://www.minecraft.net/content/dam/minecraftnet/games/minecraft/screenshots/MCV_SpringDrop_testing_Jan8_Wildflowers_8a_1280x720.jpg MCV_SpringDrop_testing_Jan8_Wildflowers_8a_1280x720.jpg] uses "SpringDrop".<ref>{{mcnet|new-year-new-testing-features|New year, new testing features|January 8, 2025|Sophie Austin, and Linn Viberg}}</ref>
** [https://www.minecraft.net/content/dam/minecraftnet/games/minecraft/screenshots/MCV_Su25_VibrantVisuals_April2_Overworld_2_1280x720.jpg MCV_Su25_VibrantVisuals_April2_Overworld_2_1280x720.jpg] uses "Su25" for "Summer 2025".<ref>{{mcnet|take-a-vibrant-test-flight|Take a vibrant test flight|April 2, 2025|Sophie Austin}}</ref>
** [https://www.minecraft.net/content/dam/minecraftnet/games/minecraft/screenshots/MCV_FA25_July22_02_Feature_CopperGolemStatue_C_DotNet_1280x720.jpg MCV_FA25_July22_02_Feature_CopperGolemStatue_C_DotNet_1280x720.jpg] uses "FA25" for "Fall 2025".<ref>{{mcnet|test-the-copper-golem-statue-and-the-shelf-block|Test the copper golem statue and the shelf block|July 22, 2025|Cristina Anderca}}</ref>
